aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class Spaceship

  • java.lang.Object
    • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
      • aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.Spaceship

  • public class Spaceship
extends GameObject
    This class represents the player in the Asteroids game. A spaceship is able to shoot every 20 game ticks (twice per second).

    A massive difference with other game objects is that the spaceship has a certain direction in which it is pointed. This influences the way it is drawn and determines the direction of spawned bullets. Although the game setting is in outer space, the spaceship is subject to traction and will slowly deaccelerate.

    Author:
    Yannick Stoffers

      • nextStep

        public void nextStep()
        Defines the behaviour of the spaceship. In each game tick the ship turns when a turn button is pressed. The speed at which it turns is 2% of a full rotation per game tick. Afterwards the spaceships velocity will be updated if the player wants to accelerate. The velocity however is resticted to 10 pixels per game tick in both X and Y direction. Afterwards the location of the ship will be updated and the velocity decreased to account for traction.
        Overrides:
        nextStep in class GameObject

      • setFired

        public void setFired()
        Sets the fire tick counter to 20. For the next 20 game ticks this spaceship is not allowed to fire.

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Description copied from class: GameObject
        Marks the object for destruction by setting the destroyed value to true. Destruction happens in the Game class that has a reference to this GameObject, by removing this reference. Afterwards it can be safely garbage collected.
        Overrides:
        destroy in class GameObject
